hypothesis_content.title: Stress Regime Recovery Pattern
hypothesis_content.statement: When market enters STRESS regime (VIX > 35, BTC 5-day return < -15%) and then shows 3 consecutive days of decreasing selling volume while price stabilizes within ±3% range, there's >75% probability of transition to NEUTRAL within 10 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Decreasing volume during price stabilization in STRESS regimes indicates exhaustion of panic selling. Normalizing funding rates suggest reduction in leveraged positions, creating conditions for mean reversion.
entry_conditions: 3 consecutive days with daily volume < previous day's volume
Daily price range < 3% for 3 consecutive days

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to NEUTRAL OR 15% price recovery
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below stabilization range low by >5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 65% of stabilization patterns lead to NEUTRAL transition, OR average continuation decline > 8% after pattern.
